data.title: Count islands
data.statement:
Give the number of separated islands on the sea.

The sea is represented by '*', the islands by any other ASCII character (2 islands can be made of the same character but not be the same island).

Each island is separated by at least one sea element (2 diagonal islands are also counted as separate).

All islands are rectangles.
data.stubGenerator:
read N:int
loop N read line:word(100)
write number_of_islands
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1 :>> An integer [[N]] for the number of lines in the map
<<Next [[N]] lines :>> A string that represent a [[line]] of the map (each line has the same length)
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1 :>> An integer for the number of separated islands

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Give the number of separated islands on the sea.

The sea is represented by '*', the islands by any other ASCII character (2 islands can be made of the same character but not be the same island).

Each island is separated by at least one sea element (2 diagonal islands are also counted as separate).

All islands are rectangles.
Input
Line 1 : An integer N for the number of lines in the map
Next N lines : A string that represent a line of the map (each line has the same length)
Output
Line 1 : An integer for the number of separated islands
Constraints
1 <= N <= 100
1 <= Line length <= 100
Example
Input
1
*
Output
0
